en: Tottenham look forward to lifting the FA cup in defeating Rochadale.
ibo: Tottenham na-ele anya iburu iko FA na mmeri Rochadale

en: Son Heung-min, Fernando Llorente and Kyle Walter-Peters of Tottenham beat Rochadale mercilessly in their yesterday's FA cup competition.
ibo: Son Heung-min, Fernando Llorente na Kyle Walter-Peters nke Tottenham bụ ndị mmechiri ọnụ Rochadale n'asọmpị ụnyaahụ.

en: Son Heung-min of Tottenham and his team mates were jubilating when he scored a goal in the FA cup competition.
ibo: Son Heung-min onye Tottenham na ndị otu ya na-nwe anụrị mgbe o nyere goolu n'asọmpị iko FA.

en: Tottenham has won eight FA cup competitions.
ibo: Tottenham emerila n'asọmpị iko FA ugboro asatọ

en: The Tottenham team has beaten the Rochadale team 6-1in their FA cup competition.
ibo: N'egwuregwu, ndị otu Tottenham gbara ndị Rochadale ọkpụ goolu isii asatara otu n'asọmpi FA.

en: This victory means that Tottenham is to compete with Swansea in the FA cup quarter final on the 17th of March.
ibo: Mmeri a pụtara na Tottenham na otu Swansea ga-asọ mpi Quarter Final n'iko FA a ga-agba n'ụbọchị 17 nke ọnwa Maachị.

en: Son Heung-min scored the first and the fifth goal. Fernando Llorente scored hatrick within twelve minutes of the second half, while Kyle Walter-Peters scored the sixth goal.
ibo: Son Heung-min nyere goolu nke mbụ na nke ise. Fernando Llorente nyere goolu atọ n'ime nkeji iri na abụọ n'okara nke abụọ, ebe Kyle Walter-Peters nyere goolu nke isi.

en: If Son Heung-min stops playing with Rochadale
ibo: Son Heung-min kwụsị bọọlụ otu Rochadale

en: What will happen in the future?
ibo: Gịnị ga-eme n'ihu?

en: Tottenham will play at the Wembley stadium on the 3rd of March. They will play Huddersfield in the Premier League before meeting Juventus in Champions League on the 7th day of March.
ibo: Tottenham ga-aga ọgbọ egwuregwu Wembley n'ụbọchị atọ nke ọnwa Maachị. Ha na Huddersfield ga-asọ mpi n'iko Premier League, tupu ha na Juventus ga-asọmpị nke ha n'iko Champions League n'ụbọchị asaa n'ọnwa Maachị.

en: Rochadale have sixteen outstanding matches to save themselves from relegation in the league.
ibo: Otu egwuregwu Rochdale nwere asọmpị 16 ịzọpụta onwe ha tụpụ ha baa relegation na league otu.

en: Their first match will be between them and Plymouth on the 3rd day of March.
ibo: Asompị ha nke mbụ ga-abụ ha na Plymouth n'ụbọchị atọ n'ọnwa Maachị.

ibo: Akụkọ ndị ga-amasị gị:

en: The head of police force (The Inspector General of Police): open/establish cattle ranch before you ban grazing.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii: Mepe ọdọ ehi tupu ị machie ịchịgharị ha

en: The Inspector General of Police has told Governors to first establish cattle ranches before they ban grazing of cattles in their states.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii agwala ndị Gọvanọ ka bụrụ ụzọ mepe ebe a na-azụ ehi tupu ha machie ịchịgharị ehi n'steeti ha.

en: Ibrahim Idris
ibo: Ibrahim Idris

en: The Inspector General of Police, Ibrahim Idris, has said that states should first provide rranches before banning of cattle grazing.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii bụ Ibrahim Idris ekwuola ka steeti bụrụ ụzo wapụta ala ebemaka ọzụzụ ehi tupu ha amachie ịchigharị ehi

en: The Inspector General of Police said this in yesterday's security meeting at Kaduna, adding that it will help to avert problems among farmers and herders.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii kwuru nke a ụnyaahụ na kaduna na nzukọ ndị nchekwa obodo metụtara sịrị na ọ ga-enye aka igbara nsogbu na adapụta n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi.

en: He further said that the problem in Benue was because the government did not establish cattle ranch before they banned cattle grazing.
ibo: Ọ gara n'ihu kwuo na nsogbu dapụtara na Benue bụ maka na gọọmenti steeti ahụ ehibeghị ọdọ ehi tupu ha machie ịchịgharị ehi

en: In that meeting whose topic was 'Development: Security challenges and the importance of proffering adequate solution.' The farmers-herders problem did not start at the era of President Muhammadu Buhari.
ibo: Na nzukọ ahụ nke isi okwu ya bụ, 'Nkwalite obodo: Nsogbu nchekwa na mkpa ọ dị ịchọta ụzọ zuru oke ịkwụsị ya,'nsogbu dị n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi ebidoghị n'oge ọchịchị onyeisiala bụ Muhammdu Buhari.

en: Idris said: 'In my opinion, to curb farmers-herders clash, state governments should strive and build cattle ranches before they make policy to ban open grazing.
ibo: Idris kwuru sị:'N'uche m, iji belata ọgbaaghara dị n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi, gọọmenti steeti ga-agba mbọ wuo ebe ọzụzụ ehi na steeti ha tupu ha eme iwu ikwụsị ịchịgharị ehi.

ibo: Nwa onyeisiala Liberia bụ George Weah a na-akpọ Timothy Weah ebidola ịgba bọọlụ n'otu egwuruegwu PSG, ebe nna ya gbaburu bọọlụ na mbụ.

en: Timothy featured yesterday in the competition between PSG and Troyes.
ibo: Timothy pụtara n'ọgbọ ụnyahụ ka PSG na Troyes sọọrọ mpi.

en: As Neymar and Kylian Mbappe were not in the game because of the injury they sustained, Angel di Maria and Christopher Nkunu scored the winning goals for PSG in this competition.
ibo: Ka Neymar na Kylian Mbappe anọghị n'ọgbọ maka ahụ ha merụrụ, Angel di Maria na Christopher Nkunku bụ ndị nyere goolu PSG ji nwete mmeri n'asọmpi a.

en: The absence of Neymar and Mbappe gave Weah the opportunity to play in this competition.
ibo: Neymar na Mbappe n'anọghị ya so nye Weah ohere ịgba n'asọmpi a.

en: George Weah scored 55 coals when he played for PSG.
ibo: George Weah nyere goolu 55 oge ọgbara bọọlụ na PSG

en: The father of Timothy, George Weah, played for PSG 23 years ago before he moved to AC Milan.
ibo: Nna Timothy bụ George Weah gbaara ndị PSG bọọlụ tupu n'afọ 23 gara aga, tupu ọ gawa AC Milan.

en: PGS have 10 matches to play, in which they should get 17 points if they are to lift this year's French League.
ibo: PSG nwere asọmpi 10 n'ihu, n'ime nke ha kwesịrị inweta ọnụọgụgụ 17 ma ọ bụrụ na ha ga-ebuli iko 'French League' nke afọ a.

en: They will meet Real Madrid at Tusde to play second leg of their champion League. In the first leg, Real Madrid won them with 3-1.
ibo: Ha na Real Madrid ga-ezukọ na Tusde ịgba agba Champions League nke abụọ ha. N'agba nke mbụ, Real Madrid ji 3-1 merie ha.

en: Their player Neymar will not play again this season because of the injury he sustained.
ibo: Onye egwu ha bụ Neymar agaghị asọmpi ọzọ n'ime 'season' a maka ahụ ọ merụrụ.

ibo: Onye ama ama dịka Eze ndị ntoroọbịa na Naịjirịa bụ Charly Boy kwuru na obi adịghị ya mma maka ọnọdụ Naịjirịa.

en: When BBC Igbo interviewed him, he asked 'why is it that it is bad people that lead Nigeria? '
ibo: Mgbe ndị BBC Igbo gbara ya ajụjụọnụ, ọ jụrụ 'Gịnị mere o jiri bụrụ ndị ọjọọ na-achị Naịjirịa?'.

en: Charly Boy said that he is looking for special youths to support for taking over the leadership of Nigeria.
ibo: Charly Boy kwuru na ọ na-achọ ndị ntoroọbịa pụrụiche ọ ga-akwado maka ị were oche ọchịchị Naịjirịa.

en: 'My heart has been telling me since thirty five years ago that Nigeria's liberation will be for special youths,' like Charly Boy said.
ibo: 'Obi na-agbawa m kamgbe afọ iri atọ na ise gara aga na nzọpụta Naịjirịa ga-abụ maka ndị ntoroọbịa pụrụiche, ' dịka Charly Boy kwuru.

en: Where other Africans are better than Nigeria in movie.
ibo: Ihe mba Afrịka ndị ọzọ ji kara Naịjirịa mma n' ihe nkiri

en: When it comes to winning in the most prominent award in the movie world known as Oscars, other Africans beat Nigeria hands down.
ibo: A bịa n' ihe nturugo kachasị ada ụda n' ụwa ihe nkiri a kpọrọ Oscars, ndị mpaghara Afrịka na-egosi Naijiria narị.

en: The statue of Oscars award
ibo: Akpụrụakpụ ihe nrite Oscars

en: 2018 marked the 90th year of Oscars award in Hollywood.
ibo: 2018 a mere ya afọ 90 a na-eme nturugo Oscars na Hollywood

en: After the events of 2018 Oscars, which is the most prominent award in the movie world, BBC Igbo investigated and found out that other African countries are better than Nigeria in the area of movie production.
ibo: Ka e mechara Oscars nke bụ emume nturugo kachasị ada ụda n'ụwa ihe nkiri nke 2018, BBC Igbo nyochara ma hụ na mba Afrịka ndị ọzọ ka Naijiria mma n' ihe gbasara ihe nkiri.

en: Oscars 2018: Between Africa and Nigeria
ibo: Oscars 2018: N' etiti Afrịka na Naijiria

en: BBC found out that despite that some Nigeria movie producers feature Hollywood stars in their movies, it has not made them to be among those named for winning any award in Hollywood.
ibo: BBC chọpụtara na n' agbanyeghi na ụfọdụ ndị na-emepụta ihe nkiri na Naijiria na-etinye ụfọdụ ndị Hollywood n' ihe nkiri ha, o mebeghi ka ha soro na ndị a na-akpọ aha inweta nturugo ọbụla na Hollywood.

en: Nollywood are those responsible for producing movies in Nigeria and other known African countries. Other African countries have shown them superiority.
ibo: Nollywood bụ ndị na-emepụta ihe nkiri na Naijiria na mpaghara Afrịka ndị ọzọ so na ndị a na-anụ aha ya, ndị mba Afrịka ndị ọzọ egosila ha nkarị.

en: Lupita Nyong'o, an American based Kenyan won the award of 'best woman producer' in the year 2013.
ibo: Lupita Nyong'o bụ nwa afọ Kenya bi n' Amerịka nwetara ihe nrite 'nwaanyị kacha akwado ihe nkiri' n' afọ 2013

en: Few years ago Nigeria was seen as the hero of movie production in Africa but now, it seems others have surpassed them.
ibo: N' afọ ole na ole gara aga, a na-ahụ Naijiria dị ka 'dike' n' ihe nkiri n' Afrịka, mana ugbua ọ dị ka ndị ọzọ agaferela ha.

en: While Nollywood themselves who are in second position in movie production produce over 1000 movies in one year, Hollywood produce less than that number of movies but it does not stop them from being those whom the whole world look up to as the producers of best movies.
ibo: Ebe Nollywood n' onwe ha bụ ndị nọ n' ọkwa abụọ n' ụwa ihe nkiri na-emepụta ihe nkiri karịrị 1000 n' ime otu afọ, Hollywood na-emepụta ihe na-erughị nke ahụ mana ọ kwusịghị ha ịbụ ndị ụwa niile na-ele anya na ha kacha emepụta ihe nkiri kacha mma.

en: In Africa Kenya and South Africa exhibit superiority over Nigeria with regard to winning Oscars award.
ibo: Mana a bịa n' ime Afrịka, mba Kenya na Saụt Afrịka na-egosi Naijiria nkarị ebe ọ gbasara ihe nrite na nturugo Oscars.

en: Head to head in South Africa
ibo: Isi n' isi in Saụt Afrịka

en: My interest is the protection of the nation's economy.
ibo: Ihe na-akpa m bụ nchekwa na akụnaụba obodo

en: When Buhari went to London for the meeting of Common Wealth of Nations leaders, CHOGM, he said that Nigerian youths were lazy.
ibo: Ka Buhari gara London maka nzukọ ndị ọchịchị mba ndị nọ n'okpuru Commonwealth nke a kpọrọ CHOGM, o kwuru na ndị ntorobịa Naịjirịa dị umengwụ.

en: What he said was not funny to many Nigerians, which made them to express their anger on social media.
ibo: Okwu a o kwuru atọghị ọtụtụ ndị Naịjirịa ọchị, nke kpatara ha jiri gosi iwe ha n'elu sosha midia.

en: One white person lent a voice to this matter.
ibo: Otu onye ọcha tinyere ọnụ ya n'okwu a.

ibo: Ndị isi Commonwealth na-ezukọ ka ha kparịta ụka ị chọputa ma nwaeze Wales a ga-anọchite anaya nne ya dịka onyeisi ga-chi ngalaba jikọtara obodo 53.

en: It was on Thursday that Queen of Britain decided that her son Charles will lead CHOGM at the Buckingham palace.
ibo: Ụbọchị Tọsde ka Ezenwaanyị Briten kpebiri na nwa ya Charles ga-achị otu akpọrọ CHOGM na Buckingham Palace.

ibo: Ọ si na ọ bụ mmasị ya ka nwa ya Charles chịa CHOGM otu ụbọchị.

en: But that position is not what the Queen would will to her son at death.
ibo: Mana ya bụ ọkwa abụghị ihe Ezenwaanyị na-ekenye nwa ya maọbụrụ godu na ọ nwụọ.

en: It is expected that the leaders of commonwealth will decide who will lead them when they converge at Windsor castle but there has not been any sign that they will talk about it in their meeting.
ibo: A na-tụ anya na ndị isi oche Commonwealth ga-ekpebi maka onye ga-achị ha ma ha zukọ na Windsor Castle mana enwebeghị ihe gosiri na a ga-ekwupụta ya bụ ihe na nzukọ ahụ.

en: Does it mean that there is no other person that can lead commonwealth?
ibo: Ọ bụ na-enweghị onye ọzọ nwereike ichi commonwealth?

en: A BBC journalist James Landale said that it has been suggested that the position be rotated among the leaders of commonwealth nations.
ibo: Onye ntaakụkọ BBC bụ James Landale sị na atụọla arọ ka ọkwa ahụ na-agagharị n'etiti ndị isi obodo nọ na Commonwealth.

en: But the president of South Africa, Cyril Ramaphosa, has cut short his meeting going in London in order to know the reason for the attacks going on in his country.
ibo: Mana, Onyeisiala Saut Africa Cyril Ramaphosa egbubirila ije ya na nzukọ a na-eme na London ka owere mara ihe kpatara mwakpo a na-eme n'obodo ya.

en: The attacks are going on in the northern part of South Africa where the protesters are saying that they should be given work, residential house and stoppage of soiling of the hands.
ibo: Mwakpo a na-eme n'ugwu Saụt Afrịka ebe ndị ngagharị iwe na-asị ka-enye ha ọrụ, ụlọ obibi na nkwụsị mmerụaka.

en: CHOGM means Commonwealth of Government Meeting in English language.
ibo: CHOGM bụ Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting n'asụsụ bekee.

en: It is the meeting of the leaders of the nations in commonwealth, which holds twice every two years.
ibo: Ọ bụ ọgbakọ ndị ndu mba ndị so n'otu commonwealth, nke a na-eme kwa afọ abụọ.

en: Those who participate in the meeting are the presidents and the Prime ministers of the 53 nations and their families, their spokes persons and journalists.
ibo: Ndị na-eme ya bụ ndị isiala na ndị Praịm Mịnịsta mba dị iri ise na atọ na ndị ezinaụlọ ha, ndị na-ekwuru ha okwu na ndị ntaakụkọ.

en: The meeting of the year held in London, while that of 2015 held was at Valletta in Malta.
ibo: Ọgbakọ nke afọ mere na Lọndọn, ebe nke gara aga n'afọ 2015 bụ na Valletta dị na Malta.

ibo: Ka akụkọ na-akọwa na gọọmentị Imo steeti agwala ndị okenye niile tozuru ị rụ-ọrụ ha kwụọ naira puku atọ pụtara, gọọmentị Imo na-akọwa na ọ gbụghị ha ka ego a dị mkpa.

en: Ebere Iwuji, the spokesperson of the governor on media and publicity, told BBC Igbo on phone that the money is to be paid once.
ibo: Ebere Iwuji bụ onye na-ekwuchite ọnụ gọvanọ n'ihe gbasara mgbasa ozi gwara BBC Igbo n'ekwentị na ụgwọ a bụ ụgwọ a ga-akwụ nanị otu mgbe.

en: She also said that money is needed to support different projects that different villages in the state are doing.
ibo: O kwukwara na a ga-eji ego kwado ọrụ dị icheiche obodo ndị nọ n'ime Imo steeti ji aka ha na-eme.

en: Despite that news is saying that one million is mapped out for every village, Nzewuji said that no amount of money was mentioned because it is those in he interior villages who are supposed to do this contribution.
ibo: Agbanyeghị na akụkọ na-ekwu na ọ nde naira isii ka eyiri otu obodo, Nzewuji sịrị na enweghị aha ego ọbụla akpọrọ, makana ọ ndị bi na imi obodo ugbua kwesịrị ịtụ ụtụ a.

en: Nzewuji said 'This money will not enter the Imo State treasury, it is owned by different Community Government Councils.'
ibo: Nzewuji si 'Ego a gaghị abanye n'akpa gọọmentị Imo steeti, ọ bụ ngalaba obodo dị icheiche akporọ Community Government Council (CGC) nwe ya'.

en: Nzewuji further said that the Imo state government will support any village that made the contribution with ten billion, while they will be looking forward to build industry and other needs of the community.
ibo: Nzewuji gara n'ihu kwuo na gọọmentị Imo steetị ga-eji nde naira iri wee kwado obodo ọbula tụrụ ego a, ka ha na-ele anya na a ga-eje ya hiba ụlọọrụ mepụta ihe na ihe ndị ọzọ obodo chọrọ.

en: 'I am thinking that any body who wants progress will support it, most especially because they are interested in community development', Nzewuji said.
ibo: A nam eche na onye ọbụla chọrọ ọganiru ga-achọ ikwado ya, okachasị ebe ha na-etinye aka n'mbu na ọrụ mmepe obodo, Nzewuji kwuru.

en: Nzewuji further explained that no king of any village is denied of his monthly salary because of this.
ibo: Nzewuji gakwara n'ihu kọwa na onweghị eze obodo ọbụla anapụrụ ọgwọ onwa maka ihe a.

en: Masquerade attacked Father Ebube Muonso's parish.
ibo: Mmọnwụ wakporo ụlọụka Fada 'Ebube mụọnsọ'

en: Group masquerades attacked Catholic congregation at Uke, Anambra state, injured some and destroyed thirty vehicles.
ibo: Ndị na-eti mmọnwụ wakporo ọgbakọ ndị ụka Katolik n'Uke Anambara steeti merụọ ọtụtụ ahụ ma mebie ụgbọala iri atọ.

en: The youths engage in masquerading.
ibo: Ndị ntorobịa na-agba mmọnwụ

en: Masquerading is one the culture the Igbos are known for.
ibo: Ịgba mmọnwụ bụ emume omenala e jiri mara Ndigbo

en: Group of masquerades who were celebrating the feast of 'Uzo Iyi' at Uke in Idemili North Local Government Area, Anambra state, attacked a Catholic prayer group and destroyed more than thirty vehicles, injured many people. One of the stabbed persons died on Saturday.
ibo: Ndị mmọnwụ na-eme emume, 'Ụzọ Iyi' n'Uke dị n'ọkpuru ọchịchị Idemili Nọt n'Anambara steeti wakporo ọgbakọ ekpere ndị ụka Katolik ma mebie ihe karịrị ụgbọala iri atọ, merụọ ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ahụ, ebe e chere n'otu onye ha mara mma nwuru n'ụbọchị Satọde.

en: The priest in charge of the Catholic prayer group Father Emmanuel Obimma, popularly known as Ebube Muonso, and other priests and ordained women escaped from the youths that attacked those who came to worship God with a vigil from Friday night through to Saturday morning.
ibo: Onyeisi nchụaja ọgbakọ ụlọụka ahụ bụ Fada Emmanuel Obimma, nke a ma ama dị ka 'Ebube Mmụọnsọ' na ndị ụkọchụkwụ ndị ọzọ, na ndị ụmụnwaanyị e chiri echichi bịara ebe ahụ gbalahụrụ ndị ntorobịa ahụ wakporo ndị gara ikpere Chineke n'ụka ncheabalị ha mere n'abali Fraide banye n'isi ụtụtụ Satode.

en: The assistant priest Francis Okoye told BBC on phone that the masqueraders attacked the vigil mass by 8pm at night and injured some members of the congregation and destroyed more than thirty vehicles.
ibo: Onye nnyemaka ụkọchụkwụ bụ Francis Okoye gwara onye ntaakụkọ BBC n'ekwentị na ndị mmọnwụ wakporo ebe ọgbakọ ụka abalị ahụ n'ihe dịka elekere asatọ nke abalị merụọ ọtụtụ mmadụ ahụ ma mebie ihe karịrị ụgbọala iri atọ.

en: Àgùlerì and Igboukwu are not the ancestral home of the Igbos.
ibo: Aguleri na Igboukwu abụghị mbido Ndigbo

en: A man has killed his children in Awada.
ibo: Otu nwoke egbuola ụmụaka ya n'Awada

en: After the attack we counted the vehicles they destroyed and they were thirty in number.
ibo: Mgbe ihe mechazịrị, anyị gụkọrọ ụgbọala ha mebirị gụta ịrị atọ.

en: They injured so many people.
ibo: Ha merụrụ ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ahụ.

en: They stabbed one person who was taken the hospital with a knife.
ibo: O nwere ọtụ onye ha sụrụ mma e bugara ụlọ ọgwụ.

en: We don't know yet whether the person is alive or dead.
ibo: Anyị amabeghị ma ọdị ndụ ma ọ nwụrụ anwụ.

en: It is clear that the youths of Uke who did the thing were prepared to persecute the congregation members because when Uzo Iyi is being celebrated, masquerading stops at 6pm but those masquerades attacked the adoration ground by passed 8pm.
ibo: O were anya na ndị ntorobịa Uke mere ihe a kwadoro akwado imekpa ndị ụka ahụ n'ihi na, a na-eme 'Uzọ iyi', mmọnwụ na-agbadebe ma ọ kụọ elekere isii nke mgbede mana ndị mmọnwụ a wakpọrọ ebe a na-eme ụka abalị ka ọ kụchara elekere asatọ nke abalị.

en: They started from beating commercial drivers who were conveying people to church, and collecting their money and their phones.
ibo: Ha bidoro na-eti ndị ji ụgbọala ebute ndị mmadụ bịara ụka ihe, na-anara ha ego ha nakwa ekwentị ha.

en: Masquerades destroyed many vehicles in the adoration ground.
ibo: Mmọnwụ mebiri ọtụtụ ụgbọla n'ọgbakọ ahụ

en: Our security operatives did their best to stop them from destroying things but when we saw that what they were doing has gone out of control, we called on the police.
ibo: Ndị ọrụ nche anyị nwara ike ha ịkwụsị ha imebi ihe mana mgbe anyị hụrụ na ihe na-eme akarịala, anyị kpọrọ ndị uweojii.

en: They came and arrested some of them.
ibo: Ha bịara nwụchie ụfọdụ n'ime ha.

en: Anambra state police said that really, masquerades attacked the congregation at Uke but they said that nobody was dead.
ibo: Ndị uweojii Anambra steeti kwuru n'ezie na mmọnwụ wakporo ndịụka n'Uke mana ha kwuru na onweghị onye nwụrụ.

en: The spokesperson of the Anambra state police, Nkiru Nwode told BBC 'We arrested three mosqurades, we are investigating what happened there.
ibo: Ọnụ na-ekwuchitere ndị uweojii na steeti ahụ bụ Nkirụ Nwode gwara BBC na 'Anyi nwụchịrị mmọnwụ atọ, anyị na-enyocha ihe mere ebe ahụ.'

en: News said that this was not the first time the youths of the village were persecuting the participants of the adoration organised by Catholics which takes place every Friday night, which attracts more than two thousand people every week.
ibo: Akụkọ kwuru na nke a abụghị mbụ ndị ntorobịa obodo ahụ na-emekpa ndị na-aga ọgbakọ a pụrụiche ndị ụka Katolik na-eme kwa abalị Fraide nke na-adọta ihe karịrị pụkụ iri abụọ kwa izuụka.

en: Those who were present at the scene confirmed that the youths of the village were persecuting commercial drivers and the congregation, collecting money, phones and other valuables from them.
ibo: Ndị nọ ebe ihe meere kwuru na ndị ntorobịa obodo ahụ na-esogbu ndị ọkwọụgbọala na ndịụka na-anapụ ha ego ma na-etikwa ụfọdụ ihe.

en: Not long ago, they beat Father Obimma's worker that made the priest to complain to police who arrested the youths of the village, although they were released when the King and the elders of the village intervened.
ibo: Na nsonso, ha tiri onye ọrụ Fada Obimma ihe nke mere ụkọchụkwụ ahụ ji kpesara ndịuweojii ndị nwụchịrị ndị ntorobịa ahụ ma ahapụrụ ha oge eze obodo na ndị okenye obodo gboro ọgụ.

en: An allegation was made that the youths always attack the commercial drivers that convey people to the church.
ibo: E boro ebubọ na ndị ntorobịa na- emekpa ndị ọkwọụgbala na-akwọga ndị mmadụ ụka ahụ kwa mgbe

en: The news that will interest you:
ibo: Akụkọ ndị ga-amasị gị:

en: About eighty eight thousand children might die in farmine.
ibo: Ụmụaka ruru puku 88 nwere ike ịnwụ n'oke agụụ

en: Benue: Herders have killed twenty people.
ibo: Benue: Ndị ọchịehị egbuola mmadụ 20

en: Which political parties will merge to take over power from APC?
ibo: Kedụ otu pati ndị ga-ekpoko iwepụ APC?

en: Ezeife: The Igbos will reject Buhari again.
ibo: Ezeife: Ndigbo ga-ajụ Buhari ọzọ

en: Eseife and other prominent people have said that telling Igbos to support Buhari for them to get presidency in 2023 is deceitful.
ibo: Ezeife na ụfọdụ ndị ọnụ na-eru n'okw ekwụola na ịgwa Igbo kwado Buhari ka ha nweta ọkwa na 2023 bụ okwu aghụghọ.

en: Chukwuemeka Ezeife and some Igbo elders
ibo: Chukwuemeka Ezeife na okenye ndị Igbo ụfọdụ

en: Chukwuemeka Ezeife, former governor of Anambra state from Igboukwu, one of the Igbo advocates in Nigeria
ibo: Chukwuemeka Ezeife,onye Igbo-Ukwu bụbu gọvanọ na Anambara Steeti bụ otu onye na-ekwuchitere Ndigbo na Niajiria

en: Prominent Igbos have said that Igbos will not support Buhari in 2019 like they did in 2015.
ibo: Ndị nwere agba n'ala Igbo ekwuola na ụmụafọ ịgbo ga-ajụ nkwado onyeisiala Buhari na ntulika nke 2019 dịka ha mere n'afọ 2015.

en: They made the Igbos to understand that it is an empty promise that Igbos will get presidency in 2023 if they support president Buhari to win again in 2019.
ibo: Ha dọrọ Ndigbo aka na ntị ka ha mata na ngwa na ọ bụrụ na ha kwado onyeisiala Buhari ka ọ banye n'ọchịcihị ọzọ n'afọ 2019 na ọkwa onyeisiala ga-erute Igbo aka bụ nkwa a na-ekwe nwaanyị n'elu akwa, nihi na ọ bụ okwu aghụghọ.

en: Not long ago, some members of APC which include the Minister of Transport , Rotimi Amechi, Secretary to the state government, Boss Mustapha and the Chairman of Voice of Nigeria, Osita Okechukwu, told the Igbos to vote for Buhari in 2019 in order to get their own share in www.
ibo: Na nsọnsọ, otụtụ ndị otu APC gụnyere, Minista na ahụmaka njem bụ Rotimi Amaechi, onye odeakwụkwọ nke gọọmenti etiti bụ Boss Mustafa na kwa onyeisi ndị ụlọọrụ Voice of Nigeria nbụ Ọsita Okechukwu gwara Ndị Igbo ka ha tụnyere Buhari na'afọ 2019, ka oke were rute ha na 2023.

en: Give the Igbo 2019 presidency: Balarabe Musa
ibo: Nye Ndigbo onyeisiala 2019 - Balarabe Musa

en: The Igbos are victimised like war vanquished.
ibo: A na-emegbu Ndigbo ka ndị emeriri n'agha'

en: But some prominent Igbos said that that statement was a deceit in order to get votes from the Igbos,
ibo: Mana ụfọdụ ndị nwere ọnụ n'igbo kwụrụ na okwu ahụ bụ okwụ aghụghọ iji nweta votu Ndigbo, kwụkwọ na ndị dịka Buhari bọrọ ndị Igbo maka entinghirị ya akwụkwọ n'afọ 2015, na ha agahị enyere ya na ntuliaka 2019.

en: In a discussion he had with the Sun Newspaper, the former governor of Anambra state said: 'There is no way it will be possible.'
ibo: Na mkparịtaụka ya na ụlọọrụ ntaakụkọ Sun nwere onye chịbụrụ Gọvanọ n'Anambara Steeti bụ Dr Chukwuemeka Ezeife si: 'A hụghị ka ọ ga e si mee.

en: I don't think we should be begging people for presidency.
ibo: Echeghị na anyị kwesịrị ị na-arịọ ndị mmadụ ọkwa onyeisiala.

en: My view is that we should go and ask God, who knows that if an Igbo emerges as the president that the Fulani, the Yoruba and the different parts of Nigeria will be satisfied because we will restructure the treasury of Nigeria for progress
ibo: Uche m bụ na anyị ga-aga rịọ Chineke, Onye mara na ọ bụrụ na onye Igbo were ọkwa dịka onyeisiala, obi ga-adị ndị Fulani mma, dị ndị Yoruba mma, dịkwara ndị mpaghara dị ichiche na Naijiria mma n'ihi na anyị ga-ahazigharị ọnọdụ akụnaụba Naijiria ka ọ ga n'ihu.

en: Talking of 2023 is irrelevant, whoever does that is up to deceiving the Igbos.
ibo: Ikwu maka 2023 bụ okwu akwụghị ọtọ, onye ọbụla na-ekwu ya bụ iji ghọgbụ Ndịgbo.'

en: On the same hand, the former president of Ohanaeze Ndigbo, Dozie Ikedife, said that the Igbos who were promised presidency did not participate the last time.
ibo: N'otu aka ahụ, onye bụbu onyeisi Ohanaeze Ndigbo bụ Dozie Ikedife, kwuru na Ndigbo bụ ndị ekwerela nkwa inweta ọkwa onyeisiala apụtaghị ihe ọbụịla n'oge gara aga.

en: He told Sun Newspaper 'The Igbos were promised the same way in the past, we were equally deceived.
ibo: Ọ gwara ụlọọrụ ntaakụkọ Sun sị: 'E kwela Ndigbo ọtụtụ nkwa dị otu a n'oge gara aga, aghọgbukwara ndị be anyị.

en: If someone deceived you two or three times, once he comes the fourth time, you have to think deeply.
ibo: Ọ bụrụ na mmadụ ghọgbụo gị ụgboro abụọ ma ọ bụ atọ, ọ bịa nke anọ, i cheba echiche ime.

en: One is tired of this nation.
ibo: Ike ala a agwụla mmadụ.

en: Ikedife equally added: 'My interest is how Biafra will be actualized through lawful procedure anddialogue.
ibo: Ikedife gara n'ihu kwuo sị : 'Ihe bụ mkpa m bụ otu a ga-esi gbaso iwu na mkparitaụka nweta Biafra na alụghị ọgụ maọbụ kpalia onye ọbụla.'

en: Recall that in 2015, majority of the Igbos did not vote for Buhari in the election which made him say that he would not treat those who gave him 95% support and those who gave him 5% support the same way, a statement many thought he has fulfilled through his appointments since he assumed leadership.
ibo: Cheta n'afọ 2015, ọtụtụ Ndigbo atụnyerịghị Buhari akwụkwọ ntuliaka nke mere ka mere o jiri si na ya aghị nye ndị nyere nkwado pasent 95 na ndị nyere ya pasent ise otu ụgwọ, okwu ọtụtụ na-eche o mezuru site ndị o nyere ọkwa ọchịchị kemgbe ọ banyere n'ọchịchị.

en: The news that might interest you:
ibo: Akụkọ ndị ga-amasị gị:

ibo: Ụmụaka ruru puku iri asatọ na asatọ nwere ike ịnwụ n'oke agụụ

en: Benue: Cattle herders have killed twenty people.
ibo: Benue: Ndị ọchịehị egbuola mmadụ 20

en: A naked man attacked a restaurant in America.
ibo: Nwoke gba ọtọ awakpoola ụlọoriri na mba Amerịka

en: The police are looking for a man who attacked people who were eating, killed four while the other four sustained injury
ibo: Ndị uweoji na-achọ otu nwoke wakporo ndị na-eri nri gbuo mmadụ anọ ebe mmadụ anọ ndị ọzọ merụrụ ahụ.

en: The restaurant where it happened
ibo: Ụlọọriri ebe ihe ahụ mere

en: The police found the gun used in attacking this restaurant.
ibo: Ndị uweoji chọtara egbe eji wakpo ụlọọriri a

en: The police said that a naked man has killed four people in a restaunt at Nashville in America.
ibo: Ndị uweo ji kwuru na otu nwoke gba ọtọ egbuola mmadụ anọ n'ụlọoriri dị n'obodo Nashville na mba Amerịka.

en: The man rushed into the restaurant at about 8am in Antioch and began to shoot people.
ibo: Nwoke ahụ tibara n'ime ụlọoriri ahụ ebe elekere asatọ nke ụtụtụ n'Antioch ma malite ị gba ndị mmadụ egbe.

en: Four other people were injured before another person who was also eating in the same restaurant snatched the was holding, he then ran away.
ibo: Mmadụ anọ ndị ọzọ merụkwara ahụ tupu onye ọzọ na-eri nri ebe ahụ anapụ ya egbe oji, o we gbapụ ọsọ.

en: The police gave the man's name as Travis Reinking, 29 years old from Illinois where they keep on looking for him.
ibo: Ndị uweoji enyela aha nwoke ahụ ka Travis Reinking dị afọ iri abụọ n'itoolu bụ onye si obodo Illinois ebe ha jisiike na-achọ ya.

en: The news that will interest you:
ibo: Akụkọ ga-amasị gị

en: Masquerade attacked Catholic church in Aambra state.
ibo: Mmọnwụ wakpọrọ ụlọụka Katolịk n'Anambara

en: About eighty eight thousand children might die of great hunger.
ibo: Ụmụaka ruru puku 88 nwere ike ịnwụ n'oke agụụ

en: Benue: Cattle herders have killed twenty people.
ibo: Benue: Ndị ọchịehị egbuola mmadụ 20

en: Soyinka: Be watchful in 2019.
ibo: Soyinka: Saanụ anya mmiri na 2019

en: Wole Soyinka
ibo: Wole Soyinka

en: The Nobel Prize winner Soyinka has said that Nigeria is devoid of good leadership.
ibo: Onye nwere nzere Nobel bụ Wole Soyinka ekwuola na ezi ọchịchị akpụọla afọ n'ala na Naijiria.

en: Wole Soyinka has advised Nigerians
ibo: Wole Soyinka adọrọ ndị Naijiria aka na ntị ka ha

en: Wole Soyinka, a well known writer, has advised Nigerians to be at alert and not to allow politicians deceive them in the forthcoming 2019 election.
ibo: Wole Soyinka bụkwa odee akwụkwọ a mara amara adọọla ndị Naịjirịa aka na ntị ka ha saa anya mmiri ghara ikwe ka ndị ndọọndọrọ ọchịchị ghọgbu ha ọzọ na ntuliaka na-abịa n'afọ 2019.

en: Soyinka, who said this on Sunday in the posthumous birthday ceremony of a well acclaimed lawyer Gani Fawehinmi which took place in Lagos said that democracy is in danger in Nigeria.
ibo: Soyinka, onye nke kwuru nke a ụbọchịụka n'emụme ncheta ọmụmụ onye ọkaiwu a mara amara nwụrụ anwụ bụ Gani Fawehinmi nke e mere na Legọs kwuru na obodo Naijiria na ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ na nsogbu ugbua.

en: He said that those who put Nigeria in her present situation through their policies have again presented themselves as messiah because election is forthcoming, and advised Nigerians to reject old politicians in order to give new age politicians the opportunity to take over power.
ibo: Ọ si na ndị tinyere Naịjirịa na nsogbu ọ nọ na ya ugbua site na atụmatụ ha, e jikerela onwe ha ọzọ dịka ndị nzọpụta ka ntuliaka na-abịa, ma dụọ ndị Naijiria ọdụ ka ha jụ ndị ndọrọndọrọ ochie iji nye ohere ka ndị agba ọhụrụ were ọchịchị.

en: Buhari and APC leaders have had discussion.
ibo: Buhari na ndị isi otu APC enwela mkparịta ụka

en: Wole Soyinka: Comport yourselves and allow an elder to rest.
ibo: Wole Soyinka: Chikọtanụ onwe ụnụ ọnụ ka okenye zuo ike

en: He said: 'It is not in doubt that democracy is in danger.'
ibo: Ọ sịrị: 'A naghị enyo ya enyo na ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ na nsogbu.

en: It is not only democracy, our country is in trouble.
ibo: Ọ bụghị sọsọ ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya, obodo anyi nọ na nsogbu.

en: I don't think that there was a time in the entire world, most especially in this nation, a time where protection of everything is soured like this.
ibo: Echeghị m na o nwere oge na ndụ niile n'ụwa , ọkachasị n'ala a oge nchere ihe niile dakpọrọ adakọ otu a.

en: We all know this.
ibo: Anyị niile maa nke a.

en: The question is whether we are seeing it as a redeeming opportunity or are we seeing it as an opportunity to keep doing those things that made our nation a failure?
ibo: Ajụjụ bụ anyị ana-ahụ ya dịka ohere nzọpụta ka anyị a na ahụ ya ha ohere ị ga n'ihu na-eme ihe ndị ahụ mere na ala anyị na akpụ afọ n'ala?

en: It is no longer a news how important it is to do the things that will save the unity of our nation Nigeria.
ibo: Ọ bụghị akụkọ ọhụrụ mkpa ọ dị imee ihe ga-azọ ịdịkọnotu ala Naijiria.

en: It is surprising that the enemies of democracy who on their own brought in policies that caused our present situation are those who showcase themselves as the messiah that Nigeria look up to, a nation that has twenty million people.
ibo: Ọ bụ ihe mgbagwojuanya na ndị bụ ndị iro ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya ndị ji aka ha webata atụmatụ nke butere anyị n'ọnọdụ anyị nọ taa bụ ndị pụtara na egosi onwe ha dịka ndị nzọpụta nke ala Naijiria na-ele anya, obodo nweere ọnụọgụgụ mmadụ nde 200.'

en: Soyinka went on to advise Nigerians to be conscious
ibo: Soyinka gara n'ihu dụọ ndị Naijiria ọdụ ka ha saa anya mmiri iji gbalahụ.

en: The news that will interest you:
ibo: Akụkọ ndị ga-amasị gị:

en: Masquerade attacked a Catholic church in Anambra state.
ibo: Mmọnwụ wakpọrọ ụlọụka Katolịk n'Anambara

en: About eighty eight thousand children might die of great hunger.
ibo: Ụmụaka ruru puku 88 nwere ike ịnwụ n'oke agụụ

en: Benue: Herdsmen have killed twenty people.
ibo: Benue: Ndị ọchịehị egbuola mmadụ 20

en: It surprises me that while talking of redeeming Nigeria, one or two groups emerged that represent some prominent people.
ibo: Ọ gbara m gharịị na ka a na-ekwu okwu ịzọpụta ala Naijiria, otu otu maọbụ abụọ pụtara ndị nwere ndị nọ n'isi ya na eso.

en: I am telling people to suspect them because those who exert themselves on these groups are those who kept democracy in Nigeria in its today's bad situation.
ibo: A na ma agwa ndị mmadụ ka ha na-enyo ha enyo n'ihi ndị na awanye onwe ha na otu ndịa bụ ndị soro dowe Naijiria na ọnọdụ ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ taa.

en: Why didn't Nigerians attend the meeting held in America?
ibo: Kedu ihe mere ndị Naịjirịa agaghị nzụkọ mgbere n'Amerịka?

en: Government of Nigeria have exonerated themselves from the meeting between investors and ministers held in America
ibo: Gọọmentị Naịjirịa agọrọla ọnu ha maka ihe mere na nzụkọ ndị chọrọ itinye ego na Naịjirịa na ndị minista nwere n'Amerịka.

en: Yemi Osibanjo and Abuja
ibo: Yemi Osibanjo na Abuja

en: Yemi Osibanjo is among those whose names are in the book for organising the meeting.
ibo: Yemi Osibanjo so na ndị aha dị n'akwụkwọ eji hazie ha bụ nzụkọ

en: So many ambassadors of Nigeria who were expected to be in the meeeting organised by Nigeria embassy in Washington DC in America were not present in the event.
ibo: Ọtụtụ ndị na-anọchịte anya gọọmentị Naịjirịa atụrụanya na ha nọ n'ọgbakọ ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka Naịjirịa na mba Amerịka haziri n'obodo Washington DC egosịghị ihu na ya bu emume.

en: The absence of the government officials made the people hopeful that Nigeria will not get loan from overseas.
ibo: Ọbịbịa ndị gọọmentị ahụ abịaghị mere ka ndị mmadụ na-enwe ịtụnanya na Naịjirịa agaghị enweta ntunye ego site na mba ofesi.

en: Those who were supposed to be present include the vice president Yemi Osibanjo, Minister of finance Kemi Adeosun, Minister of petroleum Ibe Kachikwu, Minister of Agriculture Audu Ogbeh, Minister of technology Ogbonnaya Onu,Minister of Information Lai Mohammed, Minister of Mineral resources Kayode Fayemi and Minister of Commerce Okechukwu Enelamah.
ibo: Ndị kwesiri ịga ebe ahu gunyere osote onyeisiala bụ Yemi Osinbajo, mịnịsta na-ahụ maka ego bụ Kemi Adeosun, mịnịsta nke mmanụ agbịdị bụ Ibe Kwachukwu, mịnịsta nke ọrụugbo bu Audu Ogbeh, mịnịsta nke tecknụzụ bụ Ogbonnaya Onu, mịnịsta mgbasaozi bụ Lai Mohammed, mịnịsta nke okwute ndị bara uru bụ Kayode Fayemi na mịnịsta nke mgbere bụ Okechukwu Enelamah.

en: Tax on tobacco and drinks has increased.
ibo: Ụtụ anwụrụ na mmanya etinyela ego

en: Switzerland has agreed to return Abacha's loot.
ibo: Switzerland ekwetala iweghachite ego Abacha buuru

en: An individual, Sanusi Lamido, the king of Kano and once the governor of central bank of Nigeria, was dissatisfied with the action of the government.
ibo: Otu onye ihe a ndị gọọmentị mere na-ewute bụ Emir nke Kano Sanusi Lamido, bụ onye rụbụrụ ọrụ ka onye nhazi ụlọakụ ukwu na Naịjirịa.

en: What Sanusi said
ibo: Ihe Sanusi kwuru

en: Sanusi said that one who supports investing money in Africa should take Nigeria, Ghana, Ruwanda, Kenya, and South Africa.
ibo: Sanụsi kwuru na onye na-akwado itinye ego n'Afịrịka, 'o nwere Naijirịa, onwere Gana, o nwere Rụwanda, Kenya na Sawụt Afịrịka'.

en: He went further to say 'Nigeria maybe better than others in trading but an investor may say, instead of investing $500 in Nigeria let him invest $100 in Ghana, $100 in Ruwanda, $100 in Coted'Ivoire to get robust gain.
ibo: Ọ gakwara n'ihu kwuo, 'Naịjirịa nwere ike karịa ndi ọzọ niile n'ịtụ mgbere, mana o nwere ike sị kama ya ga etinye dọla 500 na Naịjirịa, ka m tinye dọla 100 na Ghana, dọla 100 na Rụwanda, dọla 100 na Code Vuwa, ka o nweta nrite mgbasa aka.'

en: We went to have a meeting with foreign investors, we were supposed to start by 9 o'clock but started by 10 o'clock.
ibo: Anyị gara ka anyị na ndị nwere ego ha na-etinye na mba mee nzụkọ, anyị kwesiri ibido na elekere itoolu, anyị wee bido na elekere iri.

en: When I got to that place, they took m to the office of the Nigeria Ambassador.
ibo: Mgbe m ruru ebe ahụ, ha kpọrọ m ga n'ụlọọrọ onye na-anọchịte anya Naịjirịa.

en: Those who came for the meeting were there, the Vice president was absent, the Ministers were absent, said Sanusi.
ibo: Ndị bịara nzụkọ ahụ nọ ebe ahụ, osote onyeisiala anọghị, ndị mịnịsta anọghị, Sanusi kwuru.

en: Sanusi said that what they did was not good, because it showed that Nigeria was not yet prepared for what was being talked about.
ibo: Sanusi sị na ihe a mere adịghị mma, maka na ọ na-egosi na Naịjirịa adịbeghi nkwadobe maka ihe a na-ekwu okwu ya.

en: He said 'You called people to come and hear how trading is done in Nigeria but you did not come. '
ibo: O kwuru, 'Unu kpọrọ ndị mmadụ ka ha bịa nụrụ etu e si atụ mgbere na Naịjirịa, mana unu abịaghị.

en: This is not how to get people that will invest in Nigeria.
ibo: Ọbụghi etu a ka esi enwete ndị ga-etinye ego na Naịjirịa.

en: If it were to be Ruwandans that organised this meeting, their president, Paul Kagame would be there telling the people to start coming to Ruwanda.
ibo: Ya bụrụ na ọ bụ ndị Rụwanda haziri ọgbakọ a, onyeisiala ha bu Kagame ga-anọ ebe ahụ na-agwa ndi mmadụ bịawa Rụwanda.

en: People lent their voices on social media
ibo: Ndị mmadụ tinyekwere ọnụ n'okwu a na soshal midia.

en: The owner of the handle @SegunAndrews agreed to what Sanusi said.
ibo: Onye nwere akara @SegunAndrews kwenyere n'ihe Sanusi kwuru.

en: But, the government have denied that it was not how the thing happened.
ibo: Mana, gọọmentị ekwuola na ọbụghị etu a ka ha bụ ihe siri ga.

en: Lai Mohammed, the Minister of information has sent out message explaining that it was not true that those who were supposed to go for the meeting did not go.
ibo: Laị Mohammed bụ mịnịsta na-ahụ maka mgbasaozi zipuru ozi na-akọwa na ọ bụghị eziokwu na ndị kwesịrị ịga ya bụ nzụkọ agaghị.

en: Mohammed explained that the ministers whose names were in this event did not receive invitation to come, or were in Washington DC when this meeting was going on.
ibo: Mohammed na-akọwa na ndị mịnịsta aha ha dị n'emume a enwetaghị akwụkwọ e ji si ha bịa ya, maọbụ nọdụ na Washịntịn DC mgbe ọgbakọ a na-eme.

en: He said that the Ministers of Agriculture, electricity and Labour, and Wealth creation did not get invitation despite that they were scheduled to give talk in the meeting.
ibo: O kwuru na mịnịsta ọrụugbo, nke ọkụ latrik na ọrụ na nke okike ego na-ahazi enwetaghi akwụkwọ agbanyeghị na aha ha dị n'akwụkwọ ndị ga-ekwu okwu na ya bụ ọgbako.

en: Minister of Commerce himself went to the meeting of the commonwealth leaders in London with the President.
ibo: Mịnịsta nke mgbere na onwe ya so onyeisiala gawa nzụkọ ndị na-achị mba ndị so na Commonwealth bi na London.

en: Minister of Finance was in Washington DC, but she was there for the meeting of world bank and IMF.
ibo: Mịnịsta na-ahu maka ego nọ na Washịntịn DC, mana ọ bụ maka nzụkọ ndị ụlọakụ ụwa na IMF.

en: He went further to say that Minister of Information and culture got invitation, but he told the organisers of the meeting that he would not make it because of other things.
ibo: Ọ gakwara n'ihu kwuo na mịnịsta na-ahu maka mgbasa ozi na omenala nwetere akwukwọ, mana ọ zara ya were gwa ndị na-ahazi ọgbako a na ya agaghị aganwu maka ihe ndị ọzọ aka ya di na ya.

en: Lai Mohammed said 'These things showed that it should not be said that the ministers refused to go for the meeting. '
ibo: Lai Mohammed kwuru na 'Ihe ndị a gosiri na e kwesịghị ikwu na ndị Minista ekweghi ịga ya bu nzụkọ.

en: Don't allow Igbo to into extinction.
ibo: Ekwela ka Igbo nwụọ'

en: Ikeogu Oke won $10,000 as the winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature.'
ibo: Ikeogu Oke ritere puku dọla 100 dịka onye ọkachasị ede mbem na Naịjira n'afọ 2017.

en: The winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature,' Ikeogu Oke has said that Igbo will not go into extinction if the Igbos value it
ibo: Onye ritere ihe nrite dịka onye bụ ọkachasị n'ide akwụkwọ na Naịjirịa n'afọ 2017 bụ Ikeogu Oke ekwuola na asụsụ Igbo agaghị anwụ ma ndị Igbo kpọọ ya mkpa.

en: Ikeogu received $10,000 as the winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature' for his book 'The Heresaid.'
ibo: Ikeogu ritere ego puku dọla 100 dịka onye kachasị ede mbem na Naịjirịa nke a kpọrọ 'Nigerian Prize of Literature' maka akwụkwọ ya ọ kpọrọ “The Heresiad”.

en: What made the book the best was that he wrote it in the form of Igbo oral poem.
ibo: Ihe mere akwụkwọ ahụ ọdị iche bụ na o dere ya n'usoro ndị Igbo ji agụ mbem.

en: In his discussion with the BBC Igbo Mr Oke talked of the promotion of Igbo language and those whose duty it is to do it.
ibo: Na mkparịta ụka ya na BBC Igbo nwere, Maazị Oke kwuru okwu gbasara nchekwa asụsụ Igbo, na onye o chere na o kwesịri ịdị n'aka ya.

en: The federal government has decided on what to do with Abacha's loot.
ibo: Gọọmentị etiti ekwuola ihe a ga-eji ego Abacha zuru mee

en: The Minister of Finance Kemi Adeosun has said what the government will use Abacha's loot for in Nigeria.
ibo: Kemi Adeosun bụ minista na-elekọta ihe gbasara ego ekwuola ihe gọọmentị etiti ga-eji ego Abacha mee na Naịjirịa.

en: Kemi Adeosun and Christine Lagarde, the chairman of IMF
ibo: Kemi Adeosun na Christine Lagarde bụ onyeisi oche na IMF

en: The Nigerian government have mapped out what to do with more than three hundred million dollars Abacha's loot returned by Swiss.
ibo: Gọọmentị Naijiria akwadola iji ihe kariri dọlla nde dọlla narị atọ bụ ego Abacha zuru nke gọọmentị Swiss weghachitere ga-eme.

en: Minister of Finance, Kemi Adeosun, has said that the money would be given to the poor as contained in campaign promises of President Buhari.
ibo: Minista na-ahụ maka ihe gbasara ego bụ Kemi Adeosun ekwuola na a ga-eji ego ahụ zụọ ndị ụbiam dịka Onyeisiala Buhari kwere na nkwa mgbe ọ na-azọ ọchịchị.

en: She said this while speaking to journalists at the end of the meeting International Monetary Fund in Washington DC, America.
ibo: O kwuru nke a ebe ọ na-ezi ndị ntaakụkọ ozi na ngwucha nzụkọ ngalaba na-eke ego n'ụwa niile bụ IMF na-aha ịchafụ nke mere n'obodo Washington na Amerịka.

en: Adeosun also said that the money has been deposited in Nigeria's special treasury in the central bank of Nigeria in order to think out best idea for the poor.
ibo: Adeosun sị kwa na-etinyela ego a n'akpa pụrụiche n'ụlọakụ Niajiria a kpọrọ CBN n'aha ịchafụ iji bido mepụta atụmatụ ndị ga-enyere ndị ogbenye aka.

en: Tax on tobacco and drinks has increased.
ibo: Ụtụ anwụrụ na mmanya etinyela ego

en: The Senate has invited the governor of Central Bank.
ibo: Ndị sinetị akpọọla onyeisi ụlọakụ ukwu

en: In his message, he said that the federal government is hopeful that if it implements the policy it has, it shall well with Nigeria .
ibo: Na ozi ọ na-agbasa, ọ sị na gọọmentị etiti nwere olileanya na ha mepụta atụmatụ ha bu n'obi, n'ihe ga na-adịri Naịjiria mma.

en: In his own world 'If we put these policies into production, the property of Nigeria will appreciate.'
ibo: N'olu ya 'Anyị tinye atụmatụ ndị a na mmepụta, akụ na ụba obodo Naịjiria ga-arị elu'

en: What does Nigeria benefit from CHOGM?
ibo: Kedu ihe Naịjirịa na-erite na CHOGM?

en: An Igbo indegene has won Big Brother.
ibo: Nwaafọ Igbo emeriela Big Brother Naija

en: Nigerians did not attend meeting in America.
ibo: Ndị Naịjirịa agaghị nzụkọ n'Amerịka?

en: Three things single exchange rate will cause
ibo: Ihe atọ inwe ọtụtụ ọnụ mgbanwe ego na-ebute

en: IMF told Nigeria to harmonize its exchange rate to a single price, while professionals are talking of disadvantages of having more than one exchange price.
ibo: IMF gwara Naijiria ka ọ chịkọta ọnụ mgbanwe ego ya ka ọ bụrụ otu, ebe ndị ọkacharamara na-ekwu ọghọm dị na inwe ọtụtụ.

en: Naira
ibo: Naira

en: EFCC said that Umar wants ten million naira.
ibo: EFCC kwuru na Umar chọ nde naira ịrị

en: To have a steady exchange rate, IMF has advised Nigeria to harmonize its exchange rate to a single price.
ibo: Iji mee ka mgbanwe ọnụ ego Naijiria kwụdosie ike, IMF adụọla Naijiria ọdụ ka o jikọta mgbanwe ego ya ọnụ.

en: Nigeria has at least five exchange rates: one for petroleum exporters in Nigeria, one for Muslim faithful going for Mecca in Saudi Arabia, one for Christians going for Pilgrimage, another for those studying overseas and one fixed by government.
ibo: Naijiria nwere opeka mpe mgbanwe ego ise ; otu maka ndị na-atụbata mmanụ ụgbọala na Najiria, otu maka ndị ụkaalabụkụba na-aga njem okwukwe na Saudi Arabia, otu maka ndị ụka Kraist na-aga ala nsọ, ọzọ maka ndị na-agụ akwụkwọ na mba ofesi na otu ọnụ nke gọọmenti hiwere.

en: Property experts Pat Utomi and Uche Uwaleke explained to BBC journalists that it is disadvantageous to have many exchange rates.
ibo: Dịka ndị ọkacharamara n'okwu akụnaụba bụ Pat Utomi na Uche Uwaleke siri kọwara onyentakụkọ BBC, inwe ọtụtụ mgbanwe ego nwere ọghọm.

en: These are some of the disadvantages of many exchange rates
ibo: Lee ụfọdụ ọghọm inwe ọtụtụ mgbanwe ego:

en: It causes soiling of the hands
ibo: Ọ na-ebute mmerụaka

en: Pat Utomi explained that it causes favouritism as it gives someone who knows those in charge the opportunity to buy money at a cheaper rate while another who does not have such opportunity but needs the money to import materials for production of goods will not get it.
ibo: Pat Utomi kọwara na ọ na-eme ' Onye maa mmadụ enwe ohere igote ego n'ọnụala ma were ya tụọ mgbere, mana onye nwere mkpa ego ahụ iji tubata ihe ọ ga-eji mepụta ngwa ahịa n'ala anyị na amaghị mmadụ ọ gaghị eru ya aka.

en: It is not good for the progress of buying and selling.
ibo: Ọdịghị mma maka ọganihu azụmahịa.'

en: Where Abacha's money will go into
ibo: Ebe ego Abacha ga-aba

en: Money exchange: Has the exchange of dollar for naira reduced
ibo: Mgbanwe ego: Dọla ọdaala n'akụkụ Naịra?

en: In his words, Uche Uwaleke gave an analogy saying 'As government exchange rate is N305, if it is sold to someone at that rate, that person may sold it to another at N365, thereby making profit. But if there is a single fixed rate, you cannot resale it.'
ibo: N'okwu ya, Uche Uwaleke nyere ọmụmatụ sị, 'Dịka ọnụ ego mgbanwe nke gọọmenti bụ N305, e resi mmadụ n'ọnụ ahụ, o nwere ike hapụ ihe a sịrị ya gote, resi ya onye ọzọ N365, nweta ọmụrụnwa. Mana ọ bụrụ na e nwere otu mgbanwe ego, ị gaghị enwe ike iregharị ya.'

en: It kills the spirit of productivity in a nation.
ibo: Ọ na-emenyụ ọkụ itinye uchu na imepụta ihe n' obodo.

en: Uwaleke said that multiple exchange rate causes many to be lazy.
ibo: Uwaleke sịrị na inwe mgbanwe ego dị ọtụtụ na-eme ọtụtụ ha dị uwengwụ.

en: The only thing they will do is to engage in the sale of low exchange, there will be no productivity.
ibo: Sọọsọ ihe ha ga na-eme bụ ire ego dị ọnụala, agahị na-enwe mmepụta ihe.

en: It lowers multiplication of wealth in a nation.
ibo: Ọ na eweda mmụbanye akụnaụba obodo

en: Utomi said 'if people get foreign exchange at cheaper rate to send their children overseas for study, it will make everybody to want to send their children overseas and the schools in our country will suffer.
ibo: Utomi kwuru na 'ọ bụrụ na ndị mmadụ na-enweta ego mgbanwe ego n'ọnụ ala iji ziga nwa ha obodo oyibo maka ịgụ akwụkwọ, ọ ga-eme ka onye ọbụla chọọ iziga nwa ya obodo oyibo, ụlọ akwụkwọ ndị dị n'obodo anyị ga akpụ afọ n'ala.

en: Saraki and Ekweremadu: What people are saying about stopping them
ibo: Saraki na Ekweremadu: Ihe ndị mmadụ na-ekwu maka mgbochi ha

en: Ekweremadu hid his wealth
ibo: Ekweremadu 'zoro akụnaụba ya'

en: Ekweremadu was again charged for peace in Nigeria.
ibo: E tinyela udo Naịjirịa n'aka Ekweremadu ọzọ

en: There are 109 senators, if 108 senators are in Ekweremadu's house now, it means that all of them are in his house.
ibo: Ndị omeiwu sineti dị mmadị 109, ọ bụrụ na mmadụ 108 nọ na be Ekweremmadu ugbua, ọ pụtara na ha niile nọ na be ya.

en: Remember that the Senate resolved today that security agents should immediately leave the deputy senate president's house, where they attacked him today.
ibo: Cheta na ụlọomeiwu sineti kpebiri taa ka ndị ọrụ nchekwa pụọ n'ụlọ osote onyeisi sineeti bụ Ike Ekweremadu ozugbo, ebe ha wakporo taa.

en: Ekweremadu was blocked from leaving his house this morning, which stopped him from attending today's Senate meeting, where 14 senators defected from APC to PDP.
ibo: E gbochiri Ekweremadu ịpụta n'ụlọ ya n'ụtụtụ taa, mere ka ọ ghara ịbịa nzukọ ndị ụlọomeiwu ukwu mere taa, ebe ndị omeiwu ruru 14 hapụrụ APC gafee PDP.

en: Uche Anichukwu, Ekweremadu's spokesperson, told BBC Igbo that it was EFCC that blocked him from leaving his house in Abuja, not DSS as was formerly written by us.
ibo: Uche Anichukwu bụ ọnụ na-ekwuchitere Ekweremadu, gwara BBC Igbo na ndị EFCC gbochiri ya ịpụ n'ụlọ ya n'Abuja, na ọ bụghị DSS dịka anyị dere mbụ.

en: @MrBanksOmishore, Special Assistant to Saraki, this morning wrote the message EFCC sent to Ekweremadu on Twitter.
ibo: @MrBanksOmishore bụ onye enyemaka pụrụiche nke Bukola Saraki, depụtara akwụkwọ ozi ndị EFCC ziteere Ekweremadu n'ụtụtụ a, na Twitter.

en: In that message, EFCC said that they want to probe Ekweremadu for planning to use his position to manipulate carrying out of the country called money laundering in English.
ibo: N'ime akwụkwọ ozi ahụ, EFCC kwuru na ha chọrọ inyocha Ekweremadu maka ịkpa nkata, mmerụ ikike ọkwa ya nyere ya na ibupu ego nke Bekee kpọrọ 'money laundering'.

en: When Saraki entered the Senate building and started plenary, he said that Ekweremadu could not come, and said that they should strive to see that democracy did not die.
ibo: Ka Saraki banyere n'ụlọomeiwu ma bido 'plenary', o kwutere okwu na Ekweremdu abịanwughị, ma kwuo na-ekwesịrị ịgba mbọ hụ na ọchịchị onyekwuouche ya emebighị.

en: Senator Sam Anyanwu said that he was with Ekweremadu yesterday but he did not get a warrant of being wanted by the police.
ibo: Omeiwu Sam Anyanwu kwuru na ya na Ekweremadu nọ ụnyaahụ, mana onweteghị akwụkwọ gosiri na ndị uweojii na-achọ ya.

en: After the plenary, the senators resolved that the security agents should leave the house of the Deputy Senate President to enable him utilize the authority due to him.
ibo: Ka e mechara 'plenary', ndị omeiwu kpebiri na ndị ọrụ nchekwa kwesịrị ịpụ n'ụlọ osote onyeisi sineeti bụ Ike Ekweremadu ozugbo, ka o nwee ike rite ikike ruru ya.

en: This morning, Saraki is among those blocked from leaving their houses.
ibo: N'ụtụtụ a, Saraki so na ndị egbochiri ịpụ n'ezi ụlọ ya.

en: On the other hand, Nigeria President, Muhammadu Buhari thanked those that defected from APC today and wished them well.
ibo: N'aka ọzọ, onyeisi ala Naịjirịa bụ Muhammadu Buhari kelere ndị siri na APC pụọ taa ka ọ gara ha nke ọma.

en: He said this through His Twitter handle, @MBuhari.
ibo: O kwuru nke a site na akara Twita ya bụ @MBuhari:

en: EFCC blocked Ekweremadu's door in Abuja.
ibo: Ndị EFCC gbochiri ọnụụzọ Ekweremadu n'Abuja

en: Television was showing EFCC's gun pointing at the front of Ekweremadu's house.
ibo: Ihe onyoonyo na-egosi ebe ndị EFCC chewere n'ihu ụlọ Ekweremadu:

en: Those who kidnapped and killed a Catholic priest have been sentenced to death.
ibo: A maala ndị tọọrọ ma gbuo ụkọchuckwu ụka Katolik ikpe ọnwụ

en: High court has sentenced those who kidnapped and killed Father John Adeyi to death by hanging.
ibo: Ụlọikpe ukwu amaala ndị tọrọ ma gbuo Fada John Adeyi ikpe ọnwụ site na nkwugbu.

en: Court has given order to hang the criminals.
ibo: Ụlọikpe enyela iwu ka akwụgbu ndị omekome

en: High court in Makurdi, Benue state, have decided to hang two people, Hartuna Idi and Suleiman Gina, who are the remnant of those who kidnapped and killed Father John Adeyi till they died for what they committed.
ibo: Ndị ụlọikpe ukwu dị na Makurdi, Benue steeti ekpebiela ka a kwụgbuo mmadụ abụọ, Hartuna Idi na Suleiman Gina bụ ndị fọrọ na ndị tọrọ ma gbuo Fada John Adeyi rue oge ha nwụrụ maka ihe ha mere.

en: Remember that four kidnappers which include Saidu Abdullahi and Aliyu Garba kidnapped Father Adeyi, the Vicar-General of Catholic church in Otukpo Diocese, Benue state, killed him and dumped his corpse in a farm near Otukpo in 2016.
ibo: Cheta na ndị ntọọ mmadụ anọ gụnyere Saidu Abdullahi na Aliyu Garba tọrọ Fada Adeyi, onye Vika-Jenaraalụ ụka Katọlik n'Otukpo Dayosis, Benue steeti, gbuo ya ma tufuo ozu ya n'ime ugbo dị nso na Otukpo n'afọ 2016.

en: What I experienced from kidnappers.
ibo: Ihe m gabigara n'aka ndị ntọ

en: Mikel Obi's father has been redeemed from kidnappers again.
ibo: A gbapụtala nna Mikel Obi n'aka ndị ntọ ọzọkwa

en: But the police later arrested four of them, they confessed that they collected N1.7m ransom but they shot him to death when they heard that the villagers were coming to redeem him from their captivity.
ibo: Mana e mechara ndị uweojii nwuchie ha anọ, ha kwupụta na ha natara ezinaụlọ ụkọchukwu ahụ otu nde naira na ụma(N1.7m) dịka ego isi ya mana ha gbagburu ya oge ha nụrụ na ndị obodo jikere ịbịa gbapụta ya ebe ha nwụchiri ya.

en: One of them confessed that he was the one that shot him to death. The remaining two were sentenced to death today being Wednesday.
ibo: Otu n'ime ha kwupụtara na ọ bụ ya gbara ya egbe gburu ya, ebe a mara mamdụ abụọ fọrọ n'ime ha ikpe ọnwụ taa bụ Wenezde.

en: In the message the family of the priest sent to Daily Post, they expressed their gratitude that at the end they got justice.
ibo: N'ozi ezinaụlọ ụkọchukwu ahụ zigara ụlọakụkọ Daily Post, ha gosiri afọ ojuju na n'ikpeazụ, ikpenkwụmọtọ erutela ha aka.

en: But they grieved that the judgement reminded them of the murder of Adeyi, who was a professor.
ibo: Mana ha tụrụ arịrị na mkpebi ahụ chetara ha ogbugbu n'ike e gburu Adeyi, onye bụ ọkammụta.

en: The Senate have ran to Ekweremadu.
ibo: Ndị sineti agbakutela Ekweremadu

en: There is a spirit living in a child that is born with dreads.
ibo: O nwere mmụọ bi na nwata bu isi dada pụta ụwa?

en: What the Igbo culture said about dreads in the ancient time and views about it presently.
ibo: Ihe omenala Igbo kwuru gbasara isi dada n'oge gboo na kwa ebumnuche sokwa ya ugbua.

en: In the ancient time, Igbo believed that people with dreads could do magic.
ibo: N'oge gboo, Igbo nwere nkwenye na ndị bu isi dada nwere ike ime anwansi

en: The cry of a new born baby in every house brings happiness to the heart of everyone
ibo: Akwa nwata ọhụrụ n'ụlọ ọbụla na-ebute nnukwu ọṅụ n'obi onye ọbula.

en: But there are some places in Igbo land where a new born baby with dreads may bring fear.
ibo: Mana o nwere ụfọdụ ebe n'ala Igbo ebe nwata ọhụrụ a mụrụ buru isi dada nwere ike ịbute egwu.

en: In a place like Igbuzo (Ibusa) in Delta state, where the people see children with dreads as special people
ibo: Ndị obodo a dịka Igbuzo(Ibusa) n'ime Delta steeti , ebe a na-ahụ ụmụaka bu dada dịka ndị pụrụ iche.

en: Who is someone with dreads?
ibo: Onye bụ onye isi dada?

en: Some stories said that a new born baby with dreads is because its mother prayed to one spirit living on earth to give her a child.
ibo: Akụkọ ụfọdụ kọwara na nwata a mụrụ ọhụrụ buru isi dada bụ maka na nne ya rịọ otu mmụọ bi n'ala a arịrịọ ka o nye ya nwa.

en: Will you have the type of circumcision had in the ancient time?
ibo: I ga-egbu ụdịrị ichi a egburu mgbe gboo?

en: Do you know the God the Igbos worshipped in the ancient time?
ibo: Ị ma chi ndị Igbo na-efe n'oge gboo?

en: They believe that dreads is a mark given to the child for recognition
ibo: Ha nwere nkwenye na isi dada bụ akara ndị mmụọ kara nwata ahụ nke ha ga-eji mara ya.

en: They call the children child-king
ibo: Ha na-akpọ ụmụaka a 'Ezenwa'.

en: They believe that their dreads is their crown.
ibo: Ha nwere nkwenye na isi dada ha bụ okpueze ha.

en: As they believe, a child with dreads will do wonderfully well in life because his God is strongly by him, they are quite strong, and they grow to be brave that cause terror in time of war.
ibo: Dịka ka ha siri nwe nkwenye, nwata buru isi dada ga-abụ nwata ga-eme nke ọma n'ụwa maka na chi ya kwụsiri ike n'akụkụ ya, ha na-esi ezigbo ike, nakwa na ha ga-eto buru dike na-ebute nnukwu egwu n'oge agha.

en: But many problems accompany those that carry dreadsmen.
ibo: Mana ọtụtu nsogbu na-eso ndi bụ isi dada.

en: It is difficult to take very good care of dreads.
ibo: Ọ na-afịahụ ị lekọta isi dada nke ọma

en: Dreads goes acredness
ibo: Nsọ sonyere n'isi dada

en: Many of the villagers believe that a child with dreads encounters many sicknesses or dies when a comb goes into the dreads.
ibo: Ọtụtụ n'ime ndị ọbọdọ a, nwere nkwenye na nwata buru isi dada ga-arịa nnukwu ọrịa maọbụ nwụọ ma ọ bụrụ na mbọisi banye na ntụtụ ya.

en: It is an abomination to touch the hair of someone with dreads.
ibo: Ọ bụ arụ imetu aka na ntutu onye bu isi dada.

en: Whoever does something like this shall give the child money immediately or tie a Cowrie on the hair.
ibo: Onye ọbụla mere udi ihe a kwesiri inye nwata ahụ ego n'aka ngwa ngwa ma ọ bụ kedo ego ayọrọ n'isi ya.

en: It is only this that will stop the child from falling sseverely ill.
ibo: Sọọsọ emume a ga-akwụsị nwata ahụ ịrịa nnukwu ọrịa.

en: It is only the mother of the child that can touch the dreads.
ibo: Ọ bụ sọọsọ nne nwata ahụ nwere ike ịmetụ ntụtụ nwata a nwere isi dada aka.

en: The tradition of cutting dreads
ibo: Emume okpukpe ịkpụ isi dada

en: Story has it that it is only herbalists can cut the hair of a child with dreads.
ibo: Akụkọ kwuru na ọ bụ ndị dibia na-akpụ isi nwata buru isi dada.

en: Now celebrities and so many other people use dreads for fashion.
ibo: Ugbua ndị ama ama n'ihe onyonyo na kwa ọtụtụ mmadụ ji isi dada eme ịnyanga

en: The must have grown and be talking.
ibo: Nwata ahụ ga-atoola eto, bụrụ nwata na-ekwu okwu.

en: His/her family will ask him/her what he/she wants as a gift item to cut the dreads.
ibo: Ezinaụlọ ya ga-ajụ ya ihe ọ chọrọ ka eji nwere kpụ ya isi dada ya.

en: Whatever he/she wants that day is what they will give him/her.
ibo: Ihe niile ọ chọrọ n'ụbọchi ahụ ka ha ga-enye ya.

en: Christianity
ibo: Uka Kraist

en: The whole Igbo land is a place where Christian faith is very strong.
ibo: Ala Igbo niile bụ ebe okwukwe ndị otu ụka Kraist kwusiri nke ọma.

en: This has caused change in many Igbo culture
ibo: Ihe a emeela ka ọtụtụ omenaala Igbo gbanwe agbanwe.

en: Now many Igbos do not believe that bad spirit lives in any child that is born into this world with dreads.
ibo: Ugbua ọtụtụ ndị umụafọ Igbo ekweteghị na ajọ mmụọ bi n'ịme nwata ọbụla buru isi dada pụta n'ụwa.

en: But they still take this kind of child to the church for priests to pray for him/her.
ibo: Mana ha ka na-akpọrọ ụdị nwata ahụ gawa ụlọụka ka ndị ụkọchukwu mere ya ekpere.

en: Doctor Anthony Mgbolu told BBC Igbo that dreads are from family generation
ibo: Dọkịta Anthony Mgbolu gwara BBC Igbo na isi dada bụ ihe na-esite na agbụrụ ezinaụlọ ahụ.

en: What Igbo culture explained about people with dreads.
ibo: Ihe omenaala Igbo kọwara maka ndị isi dada

en: An expe in the study of Africa and language in the University of Lagos Chiagozie Nnabuihe explained to BBC Igbo that Igbo land in the ancient time did not have any belief about people with dreads
ibo: Ọkachamara n'ihe ọmụmụ gbasara Afrịka na asụsụ na Mahadum University of Lagos bụ Chiagozie Nnabuihe kọwara BBC Igbo na ala Igbo n'oge gboo enweghị nkwenye ọbụla gbasara ndị bu isi dada.

en: Nnabuihe strongly affirmed that if Igbos in the ancient time had believed in dreads, they would given it a name
ibo: Nnabuihe kwusiri ike na ọ bụrụ na Igbo n'oge gboo nwere nkwenye n'isi dada ha kwesiri inye ya aha.

en: In his words, 'Dada' is a Yoruba term for dreads.
ibo: N'ọnụ okwu ya: 'Dada bụ aha ndị yoruba nyere ya.

en: That the Igbos revere dreads is because they have had contact with the Yorubas.
ibo: Ndị Igbo na-asọ isi dada bụ maka a ha na ndị Yoruba enweela mmekọrịta.'

en: But are dreads really bad thing?
ibo: Mana isi dada ọ bụ ihe ọjọọ n'ezie?

en: Nnamdi Daniels is a performer
ibo: Nnamdi Daniels bụ onye na-eme ihe nkiri

en: Many people we interviewed said that there is nothing really bad in dreads, but many people still see those with dreads as people with bad character.
ibo: Ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ anyị gbara ajụjụ ọnụ kwuru na o nweghị ihe ọjọọ dị n'isi dada mana n'ezi e, ọtụtụ mmadụ ka na-ele ndị bu isi dada dịka ndị na-eme agwaa ọjọọ.

en: Nnamdi Daniels, a man with dreads, told BBC Igbo that he has seen hell from the myriads of insult to him because of his dreads.
ibo: Nnamdi Daniels bụ nwoke bu isi dada gwara BBC Igbo na ọ hushiela anya maka mkparị ha na akparị ya maka isi dada ya.

en: He said 'I remember when I travelled to Niger state University
ibo: N'ọnụ okwu ya: 'Echetera'm otu oge m mere njem gawa mahadum nke Niger Steeti.

en: A security agent began to ask me surprising questions because of my dreads. This brought me a big shame'
ibo: Onye nchekwa bidoro ịgba m ajụjụ gbagwojuru m anya maka isi dada m. Ihe a butere m nnukwu ihere.'

en: Government has wiped off more than two million codiene cough syrup.

en: The Minister of Health, Professor Isaac Adewole, said this when the committee set up by his ministry to look into the problem of codiene came to show him their findings.
ibo: Minista na-ahụ maka ahụike bụ Okammụta Isaac Adewole kwuru nke a mgbe kọmitee ulọọrụ ya ihebere ịlabaanya na nsogbu Codiene bịara ịgosi ya nchọpụta ha.

en: He also said that this is to show that government are firm in their resolution to ban codiene medicine in Nigeria.
ibo: O kwukwara na nke a bụ maka ị gosi na gọọmentị kwusiri ike na ebumnuche ha imachi ọgụ codiene na Naịjirịa.

en: Banning of codiene: the price for cough medicine has increased
ibo: Mmachi Codeine: Ọgwụ ụkwara adaala ọnụ

en: NAFDAC has lifted the ban on Emzor and others.
ibo: Nafdac ebuliela mmachi Emzor na ndị ọzọ

en: Adewole said that his ministry and National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control collaborated in this wiping off
ibo: Adewole kwuru na ụlọọrụ ya na ngalaba na-ahụ maka nri na ọgwụ ha kpọrọ National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control na Bekee bụ ndị rụkọtara ọrụ na mkpochapụ a.

en: Remember that in May this year, BBC showed on television the havoc codiene cough syrup was causing in Nigeria.
ibo: Cheta n'ịme Mee nke afọ a, BBC nwepụtara ihe onyonyo gosiri mkpamkpa ọgwụ ụkwara codiene na-akpa na Naịjiịa.

en: It was when this was shown that the government said that they will ban the buying and drinking of this cough syrup.
ibo: Ọ bụ oge ihe onyonyo a pụtara ka gọọmentị kwuru na ha ga-amachị ọrịre na ọṅunụ ọgwụ ụkwara a.

en: The government are saying that they are still looking into other cough syrups with destructive effects.
ibo: Gọọmentị na-ekwu na ha ka na-elebaanya n'ọgwụ ụkwara ndị ọzọ bụ ọtọ m ogbu m.

en: He slept 24 hours after drinking it.

en: Igbo Tradition: The reason for marrying a woman's corpse in Igbo land.
ibo: Igbo Tradition: Ihe mere e ji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu n'ala Igbo

en: Most times people ask the reason behind marrying a woman's corpse in some areas of Igbo land, this story explained it.
ibo: Ọtụtu oge ka ndị mmadụ na-ajụ ihe kpatara e ji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu n'ụfọdụ mpaghara ala Igbo, akụkọ a kọwara ya.

en: A man and a woman in union
ibo: Nwoke na nwaanyị jikọ aka

en: Igbo does not support cohabitation without marriage.
ibo: Igbo adịghi anabata nwoke na nwaanyị ibi na-alụghị alụ

en: Most often there are news of youths who love themselves, and agreed to live together as husband and wife without fulfilling the cultural demands for marriage.
ibo: A na-enwetakarị akụkọ gbasara ụfọdụ ndị ntorobịa maọbụ agbọghọbịa hụrụ onwe ha n'anya, ma kwekọrịtara ibikọta ọnụ dịka di na nwunye, mana ha emeghị omenala alụmdinanwunye dịka ha kwesịrị.

en: Sometimes unforseen circumstances arise in this situation, especially the woman dieing in the man's house when the cultural marriage rites were not performed.
ibo: A na-ahụtakwa mgbe ụfọdụ ihe mberede dị iche iche n'ọnọdụ a, ọkachasị nwaanyị ịnọ n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ nwụọ na-enweghị mmemme alụm ọbụla emere n'ụzọ omenala.

en: Women's title in Igbo land
ibo: Echichi nwaanyị n'ala Igbo

en: Five things that interest women
ibo: Ihe ise masịrị ụmụnwaanyị

en: Is 'Omugwo' a tradition to abolish in Igbo land?
ibo: Ọmụgwọ ọ bụ omenala ga-akwụsị n'ala Igbo?

en: However, this causes confusion in different families.
ibo: Ka o sila dị, nke a na-etinyekarị ezinaụlọ dị iche iche na gbagharịa.

en: Because of this bad condition, many villages in Igbo land, made it a law that a man will marry the corpse of a woman whom he was living with him without paying the complete dowry
ibo: N'ihi ajọ ọnọdụ a, ụfọdụ obodo dị n'ala Igbo, mere ya ka ọ bụrụ iwu na nwoke ga-alụ nwaanyị ya na ya bi n'ozu, bụ nke ọ na-emeghị mgbe ọ dị ndụ.

en: The reason for marrying a woman's corpse.
ibo: Ihe mere eji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:

en: Igbo land, a man is not married unless he paid the woman's dowry.
ibo: N'ala Igbo, anaghị ekweta na nwoke alụọla nwaanyị, maọbụrụ na o mezubeghị ihe n'isi ya.

en: If even he married in court, he is expected to go to the woman's family and do things as they want.
ibo: Ọ bụrụgodu na o mere nke ụlọikpe, a tụrụ anya na ọ ga-abịa mekwaa ihe dịka ndị nwe nwa siri chọọ.

en: Like an expert in culture, Nze Olueze Ukaejuoha (Duruagwu the second) of Umuakara, Isu in Nwangele of Imo State, told BBC Igbo, this law is very potent in their village, it goes different punishments.
ibo: Dịka ọkachamara n'okwu gbasara omenala bụ Nze Olueze Ụkaejuoha (Duruagwụ nke abụọ) n'Ụmụakara, Isu dị na Nwangele nke Imo steeti siri gwa BBC Igbo, iwu a dị ezigbo ire n'obodo ha, bụkwa nke nwere ntaramahụhụ dị iche iche so ya.

en: He who does not marry alive, marries in death, is the system most villages adopted.
ibo: Onye n'alụghị na ndụ, ọ lụ ọ n'ọnwụ, bụ usoro ọtụtụ obodo si eme

en: But in Akokwa village also in Imo State, this thought is not potent at all, where the woman's family come and take the corpse of their daughter home for burial.
ibo: Mana n'obodo Akọkwa dịkwa n'Imo steeti, atụmatụ a adịghị ire ọbụla, ebe ezinaụlọ mụrụ nwaanyị na-abịa eburu ozu nwa ha ma gaa lie n'ụlọ ha.

en: The system for marrying a woman's corpse
ibo: Usoro esi alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:

en: The man will first come and told the family that their daughter is sick (he will not tell them that she is dead at first).
ibo: Onye ahụ ga-abịa gwa ndị mụ nwa na nwa ha nwere ahụ ọkụ (ọ gaghị ebu ụzọ agwa ha na ọ nwụọla).

en: They will follow him to visit their daughter, when they have seen her, they will accuse the man of killing their daughter, and the man will start denying it.
ibo: Ha ga-eso ya gaa 'leta' nwa ha, mgbe ha hụrụ ozu ya, ha ga-ebo nke nwoke ebubo na ọ bụ ya gburu nwa ha, nke ga-eme ka ọ gọwa ụkwụ na aka ya

en: To prove that he did not kill her he would agree to marry the woman's corpse.
ibo: Iji gosi na ọ bụghị ya gburu ya ọ ga-ekwenye ịlụ ozu nwaanyị ahụ

en: He will come and marry it.

en: Nigeria 2019 elections: characteristics of those contesting presidency -Muhammadu Buhari
ibo: Nigeria 2019 elections: Njirimara ndị na-azọ oche Onyeisiala – Muhammadu Buhari

en: The Nigeria President, Muhammadu Buhari is vying presidency the second term in democracy dispensation under the ruling party.
ibo: Onyeisiala Naịjirịa bụ Muhammadu Buhari na-azọ ọkwa dịka onyeisiala nke ugboro abuọ ya n'ime ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya n'okpuru pati na-achị.

en: President Muhammadu Buhari
ibo: President Muhammadu buhari

en: President Muhammadu Buhari is presently seeking vote to be Nigeria's president the third time.
ibo: Onyeisiala Muhammadu Buhari na-achụ nta vootu ugbua iji bụrụ onyeisiala Naịjirịa nke ugboro atọ.

en: He first assumed leadership in December 1983 (1984) when the Nigerian military took over leadership by force, but some of his neighbours forced Buhari out of government in 1985.
ibo: O bu ụzọ bata ọchịchị n'ọnwa Disemba 1983 (1984) ka ndịagha Naijirịa nara ọchịchi n'ike, mana ụfọdụ ndị agbatobi ya chuturu Buhari n'ike n'afọ 1985.

en: BBC debate is still on going.
ibo: Nrụrịtaụka BBC ka na-aga n'ihu ugbua

en: Buhari later became president through election in democratic era in 2015, after three failed attempts at the position.
ibo: Buhari mechara bụrụ onyeisiala site na ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya na'afọ 2015, ka ọgbara mbọ ịnweta ya bụ oche ugboro atọ n'efu.

en: When he was ruling as a soldier, Buhari was not known for respecting human right.
ibo: Dịka mgbe ọ na-achị dịka onyeagha, Buhari enweghị ezigbote aha banyere ikike diri onye.

en: Despite that we are in democracy, many people are in prison because Buhari did not agree to release them as the court decided.
ibo: Agbanyeghi na-anọ n'ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya, ọtụtụ mmadụ nọ na mkpọrọ maka Buhari ekweghị ịtụhapụ ha dịka ụlọikpe sị ka eme.

en: This man at age 76 took oath of service in 2015, and promised that he will fight corruption and insurgency, and improvement of Niger's economy.
ibo: Nwoke a dị afọ 76 ṅụrụ iyi ọrụ n'afọ 2015, ma kwe nkwa na ya ga-ebuso agha megide mpụ na nrụrụaka na ọgbaghara, nakwa kwalite akụnaụba Naịjirịa.

en: Four years is elapsing but many people do not agree that he has made any remarkable achievements.
ibo: Afọ anọ na-abịa na ngwụcha mana ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ekweghị na ihe o mere pụtara ihe anya na-ahụ.

en: He promised to defeat Boko Haram in the war Nigeria fights against the sect that wants an Islamic state in Northern Nigeria, but presently, this sect torments this intention of Buhari through its invasion of this area.
ibo: Okwere nkwa na ya ga emeri Boko Haram na-agha Naịjirịa na-ebuso ndị a chọro ikewapụta mba ofufe alakuba na ọwụwa anyanwụ ugwu Naịjirịa, mana na nso a, ndị a na-akpazị ike na-enye ebumnobi Buhari inọdụ n'oche onyisiala nsogbu site n'etu ha si awakpo mpaghara ahu.

en: Prominent individuals believe that Buhari will face strong contest with a more prominent non-ruling. The flag bearer of PDP, Atiku Abubakar is also an Islam from Northern Nigeria like Buhari.
ibo: Ndị ọnụ ha na-eru n'okwu kwenyere na Buhari ga-ezute ezigote ọgụ n'aka pati na-anọghị n'ọchịchi aha ha na-ada ụda karịa - onye bu ọkọlọtọ PDP bụ Atiku Abubakar bụkwa onye ofufe alakuba ma sikwa ugwu Naịjirịa dịka Buhari.

en: Buhari, the flag bearer of All Progressive Congress (APC) is known to be upright among Nigerian politicians, despite that some see his campaign as waste of resources.
ibo: Buhari bụ onye buu ọkọlọtọ All Progressives Congress (APC) nwere aha dịka onye aka ya kwụ ọtọ n'ime dị ndọrọndọro na Naịjirịa, agbanyeghị na ọtụtụ mmadụ na-ahụ achumta vootu ya ka ihe na-egosị mkwafu akụnaụba.

en: Imo Election Results: Seven strong points raised by Uche Nwosu.

en: It's only Uche Nwosu that came for debate organized by BBC Igbo for Imo State governorship candidates.

en: APC Imo state's spokesperson has ran to Uche Nwosu.

en: Imo APC Primaries: Uche Nwosu has been nominated as the governorship candidate of Imo State.

en: Those that disgraced Imolites are Emeka Ihedioha of PDP, Hope Uzodimma of APC, and Ifeanyi Ararume of APGA.
ibo: Ndị a tere ndị Imo ụnyị n'ihu bụ Emeka ihedioha PDP, Hope Uzodimma nke APC na Ifeanyi Ararume nke APGA.

en: The head of BBC Igbo Adline Okere said it was only Ararume who told her that he may not come because he was starting his campaign's.
ibo: Onyeisi BBC Igbo bụ Adline Okere sị na ọ bụ sọọsọ Ararume bụ onye gwara ya na ya nwereike ghara abịa maka na ya na-amalite achụm nta vootu ya.

en: The event started at 2.30 pm.
ibo: Ya bụ emume bidoro ka o ji ọkara gacha elekere abụọ n'ehihe.

en: In the debate he only came, Uche Nwosu promised that he will pay thirty thousand naira as minimum wage if the federal government implements it.
ibo: Na nrụrịtaụka ahu sọọsọ ya bịara, Uche Nwosu kwere nkwa na ya ga-akwụ pụkụ naira iri atọ dịka ụgwụ ọnwa opekatampe ma ọ bụrụ na gọọmenti etiti hibe ya.

en: Nwosu further said that his party does not have presidential candidate when responding to his support to president Muhammadu Buhari .
ibo: Nwosu gakwara n'ihu kwuo na pati ya enweghi onye na-azọ onyeisiala ka o tinyere ọnụ n'okwu banyere nkwado o na-enye Onyeisiala Muhammau Buhari.

en: Another thing he said is 'There is nothing in my manifesto that I will not do.'

en: Jane Ada: I show the world what the Igbos are known for by moulding Igbo deities.
ibo: Jane Ada: Eji m ịkpụ arụsị Ndigbo egosi ụwa njirimara Ndigbo

en: Jane Ada is an Igbo indigene living in America who explains how she sees the different gods in Igbo land through her handiwork.
ibo: Jane Ada bụ nwafọ Igbo bi n'Amerịka ji aka ọrụ ya kọwaa etu o ji hụta ụfọdụ chi dị n'ala Igbo.

en: Jane Ada who is known for drawing and painting said that it is through moulding that she explains some gods the Igbos are known for.
ibo: Jane Ada bụ onye e ji ihe osise na ọkpụkpụ mara kwuru na ọ bụ site n'ikpụ ihe ka o ji akọwapụta ụfọdụ chi eji mara ndị Igbo.

en: Jane who got her secondary education in Enugu before going to America for work said she did not know when this started but it is God who gave her this special gift.
ibo: Jane gụrụ akwụkwọ Sekọndịrị n'Enugwu tupu ọ gaa mba Amerịka na-arụ ọrụ kwuru na ọ maghi mgbe nke ji malite kama na ọ bụ Chineke nyere ya onyinye pụrụiche a.

en: The deities she has moulded include 'Amadioha' and 'Ala', two prominent deities in Igbo land.
ibo: Arụsị ndị ọ kpụrụla gụnyere Amadioha na Ala,arụsị abụọ a ma ama n'ala Igbo.

en: Listen and hear how she did this and her intension towards Igbo culture and language .
ibo: Gee ntị nụrụ ma etu o siri mee nke nakwa ebumnuche ya gbasara omenaala na asụsụ Igbo.

en: Some women football pundits have explained some of the problems of women's football in Nigeria.
ibo: Ụfọdụ ụmụnwaanyị ndị ntaakụkọ n'egwuregwu akọwala ụfọdụ nsogbu egwuregwu bọọlụ ụmụnwaanyị na-enwe na Naịjirịa.

en: Some football pundits who are women have said that Nigeria Super Falcons play better than their Super Eagles counter part.
ibo: Ndị ntaakụkọ n'egwurgwu bọọlụ bụkwa ụmụnwaanyị ekwuola na Super Falcons nke Naịjirịa ka agbata ihe na bọọlụ karịa ndị ogbo ha ndị nwoke.

en: They said that despite this people especially men do not put interest in women's football in Nigeria and Africa.
ibo: Ha kwuru n'agbanyeghi nke a na ndị mmadụ karịsịa ụmụnwoke a naghị etinye uche na bọọlụ ụmụnwaanyị na Najirịa nakwa Afrịka.

en: They went further to say that government do not put interest and money in women's football as they do in men's football despite that they win more trophies than the men.
ibo: Ha gara n'ihu kwuo na gọọmentị a naghị etinye uche nakwa ego n'egwuregwu bọọlụ ụmụnwaanyị dịka ha si eme na nke ụmụnwoke agbanyeghi na ụmụnwaanyị na-ebute Iko karịa ndị nwoke.

en: That these things are the cause that the news about different women's competitions are not heard in Nigeria.
ibo: Na ọ bụ ihe ndị a mere anaghị anụ akụkọ banyere asọmpi dị iche iche ụmụnwaanyị na-agba na Naịjrịa.

ibo: Nke a bụ nke ugboro abụọ ọ na-aga n'ụlọomeiwu ahụ dịka ahọpụtachara ya nke mbụ n'afọ 2015.

en: The House of Assembly also elected Okechukwu Onyekanma, who is representing Mbaitoli constituency as his Deputy.
ibo: Uloomeiwu a họpụtakwara Okechukwu Onyekanma, bụ onye na-anọchite anya Mbaitoli nke steeti ahụ dịka osote ya.

en: A cattle herder has cut-off a girl's head in Ekiti.
ibo: Onye ọchịehi ebepụla isi nwaagbọghọ n'Ekiti

en: Ilasa Ekiti village of Ekiti state is now in conflict over the death of a girl whom a cattle herder cut off her head for refusing to marry him.
ibo: Obodo Ilasa Ekiti dị n'Ekiti Steeti nọ n'ọgbaghara ugbua n'ihi ọnwụ otu nwaagbọghọ onye ọchịehi bepuru isi maka na ọ jụrụ ịlụ ya.

en: This cattle herder whose name is not yet mentioned ambushed the girl on her way to fetch water and cut off her head on Tuesday.
ibo: Onye ọchịehi a a na-akpọbeghi aha ya chechiri nwaaghọghọ ahụ n'ụzọ ebe ọ gara ịkụte mmiri ma bepu ya isi na Tuzde.

en: A man has burnt a woman and her family for refusing to befriend him.
ibo: Nwoke agbaala nwaanyị na ezinaụlọ ya ọkụ maka ịjụ ya enyi

en: A man has killed his wife out of jealousy.
ibo: Nwoke egbuola nwunye ya maka ekworo

en: The head of the village Ajayi Omolagba said that that cattle herder first bethroted the girl through her family as in Fulani tradition
ibo: Onyeisi obodo ahụ bụ Ajayi Omolagba sị na onye ọchịehi ahụ dị na mbụ kụchie nwaghọghọ site n'aka ezinaụlọ ya dịka iwu ndị Fulani si dị.

en: But the girl's family refused to marry her to him which made him to kill her.
ibo: Mana ndị ezinaụlọ nwagbọghọ ahụ jụrụ ịlụnye ya nwoke ọchịehi ahụ nke mere o ji gbuo nwaagbọghọ ahụ.

en: The Ekiti state Police said that it happened and that they have arrested the man through the information they got.
ibo: Ndị uweojii Ekiti Steeti kwuru na nke a mere eme, na ha anwụchiela nwoke ahụ site na kepukepu ha nwetere.

en: Fire burnt Port Harcourt Shopping Mall.
ibo: Ọkụ gbara ụlọahịa na Port Harcourt

ibo: Gọmentị River steti etịnyela ọnụ na ya bụ ọkụ mgbara n'ụlọahịa Port Harcourt Shopping Mall.

en: Secretary to the state Tommy Danagogo told those affected to be calm that they will repair the Shopping Mall so that people will start buying and selling today being Thursday.
ibo: Odeakwụkwọ steeti ahụ bụ Tammy Danagogo gwara ometutara dere jụụ na ha ga-emezị ya bụ ụlọahịa ka ndị mmadụ malite azụmahịa taa bụ tọzde.

ibo: Akụkọ na-eru anyị ntị na-ekwu na ndị ntọ atọrọla otu onyeeze na Garin Labo dị Kastina steeti.

en: The king was in his farm when the kidnappers came on a motorcycle.
ibo: onyeeze ahụ nọ na ugbo ya mgbe ndị ntọ ahụ jị ọgbatumtum bịa ọgụ.

ibo: N'egwuruegwu, Enyimba eburula iko Nigeria Premier league nke ụgbọrọ asatọ ha site n' iji ọkpụ goolo atọ meri Akwa United ụnyaahụ.

en: Enyimba have 12 points in the five games they have played, where Reuben Bala, Stanley Dimgba and Abdurahman Bashir scored goals against Enyimba.
